title: David Brezina
content:
[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222916/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222916/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : David Březina

Czech type designer and typographer, writer, lecturer, the impresario of [TypeTalks](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222916/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TypeTalks), and partner at [Rosetta Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222916/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rosetta%20Type%20Foundry). He got Masters degrees in Informatics (Masaryk University, Brno) and Typeface Design ( [University of Reading](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222916/http:/typophile.com/wiki/University%20of%20Reading), UK). From 2004 to 2007 he also ran his own design studio, with projects in graphic, web, and interface design. He has been working as an associate with [Tiro Typeworks](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013222916/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tiro%20Typeworks) and giving various type workshops around Europe.

His interest in the world’s writing systems and multilingual typeface design and typography manifests in the award-winning, multi-script typeface family Skolar released by TypeTogether. So far, he has designed typefaces for Cyrillic, Greek, Gujarati, Devanagari, and various extensions of Latin.
